#Text=20 years on : Lockerbie victims ' group head talks to Wikinews
#Text=Sunday , December 21 , 2008
#Text=The Lockerbie memorial
#Text=On this day twenty years ago , a transatlantic airliner broke up in midair and came down onto the Scottish town of Lockerbie .
#Text=All 259 people on board Pan Am Flight 103 , and eleven people on the ground , lost their lives in what remains the worst air disaster in British history .
#Text=The disaster was an act of terrorism , caused by a bomb loaded on board .
#Text=Abdelbaset Ali Mohmed al-Megrahi , an intelligence officer from Libya , was convicted of 270 counts of murder for the bombing in 2001 .
#Text=Libya has since paid US$ 1.5 billion in compensation to the victims .
#Text=Today , Megrahi 's legal campaign for freedom continues .
#Text=The Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission granted him a second appeal , saying there may have been a miscarriage of justice .
#Text=The terminally ill man will begin that appeal next year .
#Text=Wikinews wrote to Mr Megrahi in prison but he did not respond .
#Text=One who does not believe in Megrahi 's innocence is Kara Weipz .
#Text=Her brother Richard Monetti lost his life in the bombing .

#Text=Weipz , who now heads the Victims of Pan Am Flight 103 group , says she represents the large majority of victims ' families from the United States when she says that they " believe that there were others who acted with Mr. Megrahi and should be held accountable also , " when asked if she felt there was much still to learn about the events twenty years ago .
#Text=They have , she says , no sense at all that Megrahi may have been wrongly convicted ; to the contrary she now has some closure from the trial .
#Text=" The conviction has brought a sense of justice to the families .

#Text= Calling it blood money is a misnomer .

_	_	_	_

#Text=One of the aims stated by the website of her victims ' group is to maintain the memory of her loved ones ; this she felt was still being done -  Absolutely ! ! ! !

_	_	_	_

#Text=Megrahi has not been in touch with Weipz , or with any of the other victims , she tells us .

#Text=Refusing to be drawn into speculation , she tells us she has  no idea " what secret documents Megrahi 's defense has been refused permission to see might contain - she has " never seen them " herself , so she does not know what they are .

column1: #Text=She also did not feel that Megrahi should have been released upon his recent request on compassionate grounds owing to his terminal cancer , as " he is receiving the same medical treatment in prison as he would outside of prison .

#Text= Wikinews also asked her if she believes the legal process generally has been fair to him over the years - " Yes , I believe it has been fair .

#Text= Do you think we will ever know the truth ?

#Text= I would love to say yes , but I do n't think we will ever know the whole truth , " she told us .
